sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词都有"每一个"之意。
means: each ： 指两个或两个以上中的每一个，强调个别。
every ： 指3个或3个以上的整体中的每一个，侧重于整体，与all接近。

means.word_mean: （与单数名词连用，指整体中的）每一个，每个

sentences.en: Every word in this dictionary is important.
sentences.cn: 这本字典每一个词都很重要。

sentences.en: Every man is not honest.
sentences.cn: 并不是每个人都是诚实的。

sentences.en: Go to bed, every one of you!
sentences.cn: 你们大家都去睡觉。

means.word_mean: 每…一次的, 每隔…的, 每…之中的

sentences.en: Take a pill every three hours.
sentences.cn: 每三小时吃一粒药。

sentences.en: Out of every five men only two were fit.
sentences.cn: 每五人中只有两个是合格的。

means.word_mean: 所有可能的；完全可能的</seg>

lj.lj_ly: the planning should be every bit as enjoyable as the event itself.
lj.lj_ls: 策划应该和活动本身一样有趣。

lj.lj_ly: the planning should be every bit as enjoyable as the event itself.
lj.lj_ls: 策划应该和活动本身一样有趣。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to emphasize that every member of a group is included
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于加强语气］每一个；全部；无一例外

lj.lj_ly: unbelievers, every last one of them.
they insist you weigh every single thing.
lj.lj_ls: 他们坚持要你们对每一件事仔细考虑。

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)everyone is open to bribery if the inducement offered is large enough
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)人各有其价（指任何人都是可以收买的）

phrase.cizu_name: every now and again (或 now and then)

lj.lj_ly: I used to see him every now and then.
it brews a perfect blend of coffee every time.
lj.lj_ls: 用它煮出的咖啡每次浑然一绝。

lj.lj_ly: you can see cracks moving every which way.
lj.lj_ls: 你会看见到处都在裂缝。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 在各方面，完全地；同样地

lj.lj_ly: He is every bit as mean as she is.

phrase.cizu_name: every now and then 或 every now and again

lj.lj_ly: She went to visit her aunt every other week.
lj.lj_ls: 她每隔一星期去看一次姑妈

jx.jx_cn_mean: 向四面八方地，朝各个方向地
杂乱无章地，全无秩序地

entry.def: You use every to indicate that you are referring to all the members of a group or all the parts of something and not only some of them.

example.ex: Every village has a green, a church, a pub and a manor house...
example.tran: 每个村庄都有一片绿地、一座教堂、一间酒馆和一座庄园宅第。

entry.def: You use every in order to say how often something happens or to indicate that something happens at regular intervals.

example.ex: We were made to attend meetings every day...
example.tran: 我们每天都得参加会议。

example.ex: A burglary occurs every three minutes in London...
example.tran: 伦敦每3分钟就会发生一起入室抢劫案。

entry.def: You use every in front of a number when you are saying what proportion of people or things something happens to or applies to.

example.ex: Two out of every three Britons already own a video recorder...
example.tran: 每3个英国人中就有两个已经有了录像机。

example.ex: About one in every 20 people have clinical depression...
example.tran: 大约每20个人中有1个患有临床抑郁症。

entry.def: You can use every before some nouns, for example 'sign', 'effort', 'reason', and 'intention' in order to emphasize what you are saying.
entry.tran: （用于名词前表示强调）充足的，完全的

example.ex: The Congressional Budget Office says the federal deficit shows every sign of getting larger...
example.tran: 国会预算办公室说有种种的迹象表明联邦赤字正在增加。

example.ex: I think that there is every chance that you will succeed...
example.tran: 我想你取得成功的机会很大。

entry.def: If you say that someone's every whim, wish, or desire will be satisfied, you are emphasizing that everything they want will happen or be provided.
entry.tran: （幻想、愿望、欲望等）所有的，全部的

example.ex: Dozens of servants had catered to his every whim.
example.tran: 几十个仆人迎合他所有稀奇古怪的念头。

entry.def: You use every in the expressions every now and then ,every now and again ,every once in a while, and every so often in order to indicate that something happens occasionally.

example.ex: Stir the batter every now and then to keep it from separating...
example.tran: 不时搅动面糊，防止其成分散开。

example.ex: Every so often the horse's heart and lungs are checked.
example.tran: 不时检查那匹马的心脏和肺。

entry.def: If something happens every other day or every second day, for example, it happens one day, then does not happen the next day, then happens the day after that, and so on. You can also say that something happens every third week ,every fourth year, and so on.

example.ex: I went home every other week...
It has been snowing, roughly every third day, for as long as I've had the flu.
example.tran: 自从我得了流感以来，这段时间一直在下雪，大约每三天一场。

means.word_mean: 1. each and all of a series of entities or intervals as specified;
2. (used of count nouns) each and all of the members of a group considered singly and without exception;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ǣfre ǣlc (see ever, each)
